sentences.text: 2017 Notice of Annual General  Meeting and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pentair celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2016, a milestone that we marked not only with celebrations  in more than 120 locations around the world, but also with moments of reflection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The anniversary  was a reminder that our people, our processes and our Win Right values have beenand still are crucial to our growth, serving as the thread that links our past with our future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those attributes were tested in 2016, however we did make progress on several fronts during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Im particularly proud of the strong integration effort on ERICOa large, strategic acquisition in 2015  thats a great fit for Pentairas well as our improved cash flow performance, which exceeded our  target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: But we also faced multiple external challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We had continued weakness in the energy and  industrial sectors, as well as challenges from an uncertain global economic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result,  we underperformed in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While all companies face peaks and valleys in performance, we know that we can do better.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We spent  considerable time in 2016 putting changes in place we believe will help return Pentair to the consistent performer that our shareholders have come to expect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Randall J. Hogan Chairman &   Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made good progress on aligning our cost structure with the reality of a slower growth world, as  well as repositioning the company with an agreement to divest Valves & Controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect the  $3.15 billion divestiture to significantly strengthen our balance sheet, opening up new opportunities  for growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ALIGNING FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE Our repositioning centered on combining our two water businesses into one Water segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Technical Solutions business is  being named the more appropriate Electrical segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This isnt about shuffling chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its about streamlining the organization, making it simpler, leaner and better aligned for high  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Were focusing on big opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As one of the largest players in the water industry, we have developed a more coherent  strategy that we believe will allow us to improve execution, particularly in water quality and availability, and food and beverage  processing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Electrical segment features attractive niches where we protect critical processes, and keep people and equipment  safe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both segments are strong on profitability, with plenty of opportunity for additional gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within those two segments are our new six Strategic Business Groups, where we create value for our customers and our  shareholders by providing winning products and solutions, increasing revenue and driving profitable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the company rolls out the new organizational structure, its also driving the Pentair Integrated Management System (PIMS)  deeper into the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PIMS has been the cornerstone of how we do business for over 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we expand these time- tested tools and break-through processes, we expect to improve the consistency of our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR WIN RIGHT VALUES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we work to continually improve, our dedication to our Win Right Values remains steadfast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All six of our values reflect who we  are and how we do business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the values is crucial to our success, but this year I am calling on everyone at Pentair to keep  the value of Accountability for Performance front and center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR PEOPLE In this time of change, I also want to publicly acknowledge and thank all of our 19,000 employees, many of whom are  shareholders, too.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These employees bring their best to work each day; they embrace our processes and live our values people who are working together to build a safer, more sustainable world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we look to the beginning of our second half-century, Im optimistic about the changes were making and our ability to deliver  for you, our shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are chosen with a view to bringing to the Board a variety of rich financial and management experience and backgrounds  and establishing a core of business advisers with financial and management expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TENURE BALANCE <5 Years 5-10 Years >10 Years 3 4 5 GENDER DIVERSITY Male Female 2 10 DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE Independent Not Independent 1 11 EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These executive compensation highlights should be read in  connection with the Executive Compensation section of this  Proxy Statement, including the Compensation Discussion and  Analysis section (see page 30).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 our total shareholder return was 16%, a marked  improvement following the difficult years we faced since oil  prices began their precipitous decline toward the end of 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, nearly 30% of our business was directly impacted  by energy markets and our stock price suffered accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Foreign exchange headwinds and weakening economies in  Asia, Latin America, and the Middle East compounded these  challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Mr. Hogans leadership, Pentair responded  by taking decisive action to cut costs, cull our portfolio,  and redouble our commitment to the Pentair Integrated  Management System (PIMS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to these challenging  market conditions, the Compensation Committee also kept  Mr. Hogans base salary, annual incentive and long-term  incentive targets substantially unchanged from 2015 through  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2015, we did not pay out any annual incentive  compensation to our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable pay  related to our long-term incentive awards has been significantly  below the grant values over this period, and the Compensation  Committee again froze the base salaries of all Named Executive  Officers for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was an historic year for Pentair as we celebrated our  50 year anniversary as a company and marked our 40th year  of increasing dividends to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That celebration  highlighted many of the values and qualities that have been at  the core of our company since it was founded in 1966.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016,  Mr. Hogan also completed his 16th year as our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During  Mr. Hogans tenure, Pentairs market capitalization has grown  by 821% while delivering a total shareholder return of 538%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market environment in 2016 remained challenged as  continued weakness in energy and industrial markets negatively impacted the financial results in a number of our businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management responded by taking significant restructuring  and operating actions to reduce costs and maintain operating  margins, achieving solid gains over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased EPS  by 14%, adjusted EPS by 8%, operating income by 14% and  segment income by 11% and converted 109% of our adjusted  net income to free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we also announced an  agreement to sell our Valves & Controls business to Emerson  Electric Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect the sale of Valves & Controls to  significantly strengthen our balance sheet and liquidity position  and enable us to focus on our strategic priorities in Water  and Electrical.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our stock price has not returned to the $83 peak it  achieved in March of 2014 when the price of oil was more  than $100/barrel, we are encouraged by our progress in 2016  and the outlook for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Win-Right Values continue to  guide how we conduct business, including our commitment  to a performance-based executive compensation program  that closely aligns the interests of our executives with those of  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, one proxy advisory firm recommended that  shareholders vote against approving the compensation of our  Named Executive Officers in our annual advisory shareholder  vote (our say on pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this disappointing  recommendation we reached out to shareholders to gain  additional insight and to provide them with clarifying  information enabling them to make an informed decision on the  say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders ultimately supported our say on  pay vote on May 10, 2016, with approximately 72% of votes cast  in favor, but the level of support was down substantially from  the 92% of votes cast in favor of our say on pay vote in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our executive compensation program.

sentences.text: Given the commitment  of the entire Board to understanding the perspectives of our  shareholders, our Lead Director and Compensation Committee  Chair participated in the majority of the calls with our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder feedback and suggestions on our executive  compensation program were shared and discussed with the  Compensation Committee and the entire Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We found the  robust shareholder engagement process to be valuable and  intend to continue it annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the investors we spoke with were supportive  of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We listened to and  considered the suggestions and opinions our investors shared  on how to further enhance our executive compensation  program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While shareholders have different points of view,  several key themes emerged, supporting changes the  Compensation Committee had already approved in 2016 and,  after careful consideration, adopted for 2017:

sentences.text: These shareholders either arranged for individual discussions  with us or provided us with feedback that they did not require a  meeting.

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR each Director nominee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the recommendation of the Governance Committee, the  Board of Directors has nominated all of our current directors  for re-election for a one-year term expiring on completion  of the 2018 Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any of the nominees  should become unable to accept re-election, the proxies  named on the proxy card may vote for other persons selected  by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has no reason to believe that any  of the nominees named above will be unable to serve their full term if elected.

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the direction of our Board, we have instituted an enterprise- wide risk management system to assess, monitor and mitigate  risks that arise in the course of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has  determined that the Board as a whole, and not a separate  committee, will oversee our risk management process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of  our Board Committees has historically focused and continues  to focus on specific risks within their respective areas of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: responsibility, but the Board believes that the overall enterprise  risk management process is more properly overseen by the full  Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our chief financial officer and general counsel are the  primary personnel responsible to the Board in the planning,  assessment and reporting of our risk profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board  reviews an assessment of, and a report on, our risk profile on a  regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight in Company Strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least once per year, the Board and senior management  engage in an in-depth strategic review of the Companys  outlook and strategies which is designed to create long-term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year, the Board then  monitors managements progress against such goals.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board views their role in succession planning and talent  development as a key responsibility.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: successors for key management positions through various  means, including annual talent reviews, presentations to  the Board, and communications outside of meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  succession planning process is an organization-wide practice  designed to proactively identify, develop and retain the  leadership talent that is critical for our future business success.

sentences.text: The Board annually conducts a self-assessment of the Board  and each Committee.

sentences.text: The assessment process consists of  a written evaluation comprising both quantitative scoring  and narrative comments on a range of topics, including  the composition and structure of the Board, the type and  frequency of communications and information provided to  the Board and the Committees, the Boards effectiveness in  carrying out its functions and responsibilities, the effectiveness  of the Committee structure, directors preparation and  participation in the meetings and the values and culture

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 BUSINESS RESULTS*
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was an historic year for Pentair as we celebrated our  50 year anniversary as a company and marked our 40th year  of increasing dividends to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That celebration  highlighted many of the values and qualities that have been at  the core of our company since it was founded in 1966.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016,  Mr. Hogan also completed his 16th year as our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During  Mr. Hogans tenure, Pentairs market capitalization has grown  by 821% while delivering a total shareholder return of 538%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, nearly 30% of our business was directly impacted  by energy markets and our stock price suffered accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Foreign exchange headwinds and weakening economies in  Asia, Latin America, and the Middle East compounded these  challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Mr. Hogans leadership, Pentair responded  by taking decisive action to cut costs, cull our portfolio,  and redouble our commitment to the Pentair Integrated  Management System (PIMS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to these challenging  market conditions, the Compensation Committee also kept  Mr. Hogans base salary, annual incentive and long-term  incentive targets substantially unchanged from 2015 through  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2015, we did not pay out any annual incentive  compensation to our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realizable pay  related to our long-term incentive awards has been significantly  below the grant values over this period, and the Compensation  Committee again froze the base salaries of all Named Executive  Officers for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market environment in 2016 remained challenged as  continued weakness in energy and industrial markets negatively impacted the financial results in a number of our businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management responded by taking significant restructuring  and operating actions to reduce costs and maintain operating  margins, achieving solid gains over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased EPS  by 14%, adjusted EPS by 8%, operating income by 14% and  segment income by 11% and converted 109% of our adjusted  net income to free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we also announced an  agreement to sell our Valves & Controls business to Emerson  Electric Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect the sale of Valves & Controls to  significantly strengthen our balance sheet and liquidity position  and enable us to focus on our strategic priorities in Water  and Electrical.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our stock price has not returned to the $83 peak it  achieved in March of 2014 when the price of oil was more  than $100/barrel, we are encouraged by our progress in 2016  and the outlook for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Win-Right Values continue to  guide how we conduct business, including our commitment  to a performance-based executive compensation program  that closely aligns the interests of our executives with those of  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 our total shareholder return was 16%, a marked  improvement following the difficult years we faced since oil  prices began their precipitous decline toward the end of 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 we fulfilled our long-standing commitment of  delivering performance for our shareholders with year over  year increases in all key financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per  diluted share from continuing operations (EPS) were $2.47  in 2016 compared to $2.17 in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an adjusted basis, EPS  increased 8% to $3.05 in 2016 compared to $2.83 in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Please see Appendix A for reconciliation of GAAP to non-GAAP financial measures included in this section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating income in 2016 was $701 million compared to  $616 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an adjusted basis, our segment  income increased 11% over the prior year to $840 million in  2016 from $755 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment income as a percent  of sales grew to 17.2% in 2016 from 16.8% in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net cash provided by operating activities of continuing  operations was $702 million in 2016 compared to $598 million in 2015.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016  we increased the cash dividend paid to our shareholders for  the 40th consecutive year, returning over $240 million to  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sales during 2016 were $4,890 million, up 6% compared to  $4,616 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 18, 2016, we entered into a Share Purchase Agreement to sell our Valves & Controls business to Emerson Electric Co.

sentences.text: COMPARATIVE FRAMEWORK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting compensation for our executive officers, including  our Named Executive Officers, the Committee uses competitive compensation data from an annual total compensation study of selected peer companies and other relevant survey sources to  inform its decisions about overall compensation opportunities  and specific compensation elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the  Committee uses multiple reference points when establishing  targeted compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee applies  judgment and discretion in establishing targeted pay levels,  taking into account not only competitive market data, but  also factors such as company, business unit and individual  performance, scope of responsibility, critical needs and skill  sets, experience, leadership potential and succession planning.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EQUITY HOLDING POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain an equity holding policy under which executive  officers subject to our stock ownership guidelines are required  to retain 100% of the net number of shares acquired under  equity awards until the ownership guidelines are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy may be waived to the extent its application to any  individual executive officer would cause undue hardship to the  executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLAWBACK POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a clawback policy under which certain incentive  compensation earned by our executive officers may be  recouped if the executive officers fraud or intentional  misconduct is a significant contributing factor to a restatement  of financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive compensation subject to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: this policy includes cash bonuses, cash performance units and  equity-based awards subject to performance-based vesting  conditions to the extent the compensation was paid, credited  or earned during the year after the financial results were  first disclosed.

sentences.text: RETIREMENT AND OTHER BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible Named Executive Officers and other executives and  employees participate in a number of retirement and similar  plans that are described below under Executive Compensation Tables  Pension Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide other benefits  such as medical, dental, life insurance and disability coverage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to substantially all of our full-time U.S. salaried employees,  including the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We aim to provide  employee and executive benefits at levels that reflect  competitive market levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Medical, Dental, Life Insurance and Disability Coverage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance and disability coverage are available to all full-time U.S.-based  participants through our active employee plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition  to these benefits for active employees, we provide post- retirement medical, dental and life insurance coverage to  certain retirees in accordance with the legacy company  plans which applied at the time the employees were hired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide up to one and a half times annual salary (up to  $1,000,000) in life insurance, and up to $15,000 per month  in long-term disability coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of these benefits  is not required to be included in the Summary Compensation  Table since they are made available to all full-time U.S.  salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Paid Time-Off Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide vacation and other paid holidays to all employees, including the Named Executive Officers, which we have  determined to be comparable to those provided at other large companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sponsor a non-qualified deferred compensation program,  called the Sidekick Plan, for our U.S. executives within or above  the pay grade that has a midpoint annual salary of $208,300  in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan permits executives to defer up to 25%  of their base salary and 75% of their annual cash incentive  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives also may defer receipt of restricted  stock units or performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We normally make  contributions to the Sidekick Plan on behalf of participants  with respect to each participants contributions from that  portion of his or her income above the maximum imposed  by the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the  Code), which was $265,000 in 2016, but below the Sidekick  Plans compensation limit of $700,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the narrative  following the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table  below for additional information on our contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the Sidekick Plan may invest their account  balances in a number of possible mutual fund investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fidelity Investments Institutional Services Co. provides these  investment vehicles for participants and handles all allocation  and accounting services for the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not guarantee  or subsidize any investment earnings under the Plan, and  our ordinary shares are not a permitted investment choice  under the Plan, although deferred restricted stock units and  performance share units are automatically invested in shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred, if any, under the Sidekick Plan by the  Named Executive Officers are included in the Salary and  Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation columns under  Executive Compensation Tables-Summary Compensation  Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our contributions allocated to the Named Executive  Officers under the Sidekick Plan are included in the All Other  Compensation column under Executive Compensation  Tables-Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXPATRIATE BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our employees who are assigned to an international  location outside of their home country or country of primary  residence, we provide customary expatriate benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During  a portion of 2016, one of our Named Executive Officers,  Mr. Cassidy, was assigned to Switzerland and received such  benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expatriate benefits provided to Mr. Cassidy  included relocation expenses, housing expenses, educational  expenses for dependent children, a cost of living adjustment,  use of a company car in Switzerland, tax consulting services  and home leave travel and language training for Mr. Cassidy  and his family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cassidy also received a tax equalization  benefit designed to absorb the additional tax burden resulting  from his assignment to Switzerland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to his assignment  to Switzerland, Mr. Cassidys compensation was subject to  higher taxes than would have been the case if he had been  assigned only in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, some of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expatriate benefits provided to Mr. Cassidy in connection with  his assignment resulted in additional taxation to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  tax equalization benefit was designed to make Mr. Cassidy  whole for these effects and ensure that, on an after-tax basis,  Mr. Cassidy received the same level of compensation that he  would have received had he not been assigned to Switzerland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these expatriate and tax equalization benefits are  standard in the marketplace and that the cost to us of providing  the benefits is reasonable in light of the benefits we received in  having Mr. Cassidy assigned outside of his home country.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  aggregate incremental cost to us of providing these benefits  to Mr. Cassidy are included in the All Other Compensation  column under Executive Compensation Tables  Summary  Compensation Table and are set forth in more detail in  footnote 10 to that table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEVERANCE AND CHANGE-IN-CONTROL BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide severance and change-in-control benefits to selected  executives to provide for continuity of management upon a  threatened or completed change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits  are designed to provide economic protection to key executives  following a change in control of our company so that our  executives can remain focused on our business without undue  personal concern.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the security that these benefits  provide helps our key executives to remain focused on our on- going business and reduces the key executives concerns about  future employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe that these benefits allow  our executives to consider the best interests of our company and  its shareholders due to the economic security afforded by these  benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently provide only the following severance and  change-in-control benefits to our executive officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f f The Pentair plc 2012 Stock and Incentive Plan provides that,  upon a change in control, all options, restricted stock and  restricted stock units that are unvested become fully vested;  all performance awards (other than annual incentive awards)  are paid in full based on performance at the better of target  or trend; and all annual incentive awards are paid based  on full satisfaction of the performance goals (i.e., target).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if an employees employment is involuntarily  terminated for a reason other than cause, death or disability,  or if an employee who is a Board-appointed corporate officer  voluntarily terminates employment for good reason, then  the employees outstanding awards under the Pentair plc  2012 Stock and Incentive Plan will be eligible for continued  or accelerated vesting as described below under Executive  Compensation Tables-Potential Payments Upon Termination  Or Change In Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f f We have agreements with our key corporate executives and  other key leaders, including all Named Executive Officers,  that provide for contingent benefits upon a change in control  or upon a covered termination following a change in control.

sentences.text: IMPACT OF TAX CONSIDERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code limits to $1,000,000 the amount of  compensation that we may deduct in any one year with respect  to each of our Chief Executive Officer and our three other most  highly paid executive officers (other than our Chief Financial  Officer), except for performance-based compensation meeting  certain requirements, including periodic shareholder approval  of the benefit plans under which we pay such performance- based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual and long-term cash incentive  compensation generally is performance-based compensation  meeting those requirements and, as such, is fully deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee included a performance hurdle on grants of  restricted stock units in 2016 that requires our company to  meet a specified goal for adjusted net income for any vesting  to take place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This performance condition is intended to make  the restricted stock units eligible to be treated as performance- based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options that we grant under the  Pentair plc 2012 Stock and Incentive Plan are also treated
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2013 Annual  General Meeting, our shareholders approved the performance  goals under the Pentair plc 2012 Stock and Incentive Plan,  making awards granted under the Plan eligible to be treated  as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) if  the Committee elects to make the awards otherwise compliant  with the applicable requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the impact of other tax  provisions, such as the restrictions on deferred compensation  set forth in Section 409A of the Code, and attempts to  structure compensation in a tax-efficient manner, both for the  Named Executive Officers and for our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To maintain  flexibility in compensating executive officers in a manner  designed to promote varying corporate goals, the Committee  has not adopted a policy requiring all compensation to be  deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is also possible that compensation we believe to  be deductible under Section 162(m) may not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION CONSULTANT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Committee continued to retain Aon Hewitt,  an external compensation consultant, to advise the Committee  on executive compensation issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Corporate Governance  Matters  Committees of the Board  Compensation  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluated the independence of  Aon Hewitt and the individual representatives of Aon Hewitt  who served as the Committees consultants based on the  factors required by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aon Hewitt is a wholly owned  subsidiary of Aon plc, which provides insurance brokerage and  benefit administrative outsourcing services to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the year  ended December 31, 2016, we paid Aon plc approximately  $3,088,685 for these services and Aon Hewitt approximately  $292,421 for executive compensation consulting for the  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decision to engage Aon plc for insurance  brokerage and benefit administrative outsourcing services was  made by management and was not approved by the Board  or the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded, based on the  evaluation described above, that the services performed by  Aon plc with respect to insurance and benefits administration  did not raise a conflict of interest or impair Aon Hewitts ability  to provide independent advice to the Committee regarding  executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the direction of the Committee, Aon Hewitt advises the  Committee in implementing and overseeing appropriate  compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process,  Aon Hewitt provides the Committee with comparative market  data based on analyses of the practices of the Comparator  Group defined above under Comparative Framework and  relevant survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comparative market data that Aon  Hewitt provides address the structure of the compensation  programs maintained by the Comparator Group companies as  well as the amount of compensation they provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aon Hewitt  provides guidance on industry best practices and advises the  Committee in determining appropriate ranges for base salaries,  annual incentives and equity compensation for each senior  executive position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EVALUATING THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Committee employ a formal rating process  to evaluate the Chief Executive Officers performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As  part of this process, the Board reviews financial and other  relevant data related to the performance of the Chief Executive  Officer at each meeting of the Board throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the year, each independent director provides  an evaluation and rating of the Chief Executive Officers  performance in various categories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee Chair  submits a consolidated rating report and the Committees  recommendations regarding the Chief Executive Officers  compensation to the independent directors for review and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ratification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director chairs a discussion with the  independent directors in executive session without the Chief  Executive Officer present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From that discussion, the Committee  finalizes the Chief Executive Officers performance rating.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee Chair and the Lead Director review the final  performance rating results and commentary with the Chief  Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee takes the performance  rating and financial data into account in determining the Chief  Executive Officers compensation and the adoption of goals and  objectives for the Chief Executive Officer for the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EQUITY AWARD PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and approves all equity awards to  newly hired or promoted executives at regular meetings  throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a rule, the Committee grants awards  to newly hired or promoted executives that are effective the  earlier of the 15th day of the month following the date of hire  or promotion or the 15th day of the month following the date  of the Committee meeting at which the grant is approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the 15th day of such month is a day on which the NYSE is  not open for trading, then the grant date will be the first day
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: following the 15th day of such month on which the NYSE is  open for trading.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has also given the Committee  Chair and the Chief Executive Officer discretion to grant equity  awards to newly hired or promoted executives as required  throughout the year, within the guidelines of the Pentair plc  2012 Stock and Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then ratifies  these grants at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All options are granted with an  exercise price equal to fair market value based on the closing  share price on the effective day of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NON-BINDING ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY  VOTES ON COMPENSATION OF NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote of ONE YEAR on frequency of future advisory  votes on compensation of named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires  that, every six years, we provide shareholders with a vote  on how frequently we will submit the non-binding advisory  vote on compensation of our named executive officers (the  say on pay vote) to our shareholders in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  last submitted a vote on the frequency of future say on pay  votes to our shareholders in 2011, when, in keeping with the  recommendation of our Board, our shareholders expressed a  preference that future say on pay votes be held on an annual  basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with that preference, our Board has held a say on pay vote annually since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this is the sixth year  after the first vote on the frequency of future say on pay votes,  we are again asking our shareholders at the Annual General  Meeting whether future say on pay votes should occur every  one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee and our senior management to  measure how they have responded to the prior years vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons discussed above, our Board recommends that  shareholders vote in favor of holding an advisory say on pay  vote on executive compensation at our annual meeting of  shareholders every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In voting on this non-binding advisory  vote on the frequency of the say on pay vote, shareholders  should be aware that they are not voting for or against the  Boards recommendation to vote for a frequency of every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, shareholders will be casting votes to recommend a say  on pay vote frequency which may be every one, two or three  years, or they may abstain entirely from voting on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, although the outcome of this advisory vote on the  frequency of future say on pay votes is non-binding, our Board  will review and consider the outcome of this vote when making  determinations as to when the say on pay vote will again be  submitted to shareholders for approval at an annual meeting  of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends that shareholders approve holding  a say on pay vote every year (an annual vote) because we  continue to believe that an annual vote will promote best  governance practices and facilitate our Compensation  Committees and our senior managements consideration of  the views of our shareholders in structuring our compensation  programs for our named executive officers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f f At the Annual General Meeting: If you plan to attend the  Annual General Meeting and wish to vote your ordinary  shares in person, then you must obtain a legal proxy,  executed in your favor, from the shareholder of record of  your shares (i.e., your broker, bank or other custodian or  nominee) and bring it to the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, you must contact the record  holder of your shares to revoke a previously authorized proxy  or voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the effect of broker non-votes and abstentions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker holding shares for a  beneficial owner does not vote on a particular agenda item  because the broker does not have discretionary voting power  for that particular item and has not received instructions from  the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although brokers have discretionary  power to vote your shares with respect to routine matters,  they do not have discretionary power to vote your shares on  non-routine matters pursuant to New York Stock Exchange  (NYSE) rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide voting instructions for  proposals considered non-routine a broker non-vote  occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Proposals 1, 2, 3 and 6 will be  considered non-routine under NYSE rules and therefore  your broker will not be able to vote your shares with respect  to these proposals unless the broker receives appropriate  instructions from you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a broker does not receive voting  instructions from you regarding Proposals 1, 2, 3 and 6, the  broker non-vote will have no effect on the vote on such  agenda items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The routine proposals in this Proxy Statement  are Proposals 4 and 5, for which your broker has discretionary  voting authority under the NYSE rules to vote your shares, even if the broker does not receive voting instructions from you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are the notice and access rules and how do they  affect the delivery of the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who will count the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SECs notice and access rules allow us to deliver proxy  materials to our shareholders by posting the materials on an  Internet website, notifying shareholders of the availability of  the proxy materials on the Internet and sending paper copies  of proxy materials upon shareholder request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe  that the notice and access rules allow us to use Internet  technology that many shareholders prefer, continue to provide  our shareholders with the information that they need and,  at the same time, ensure more prompt delivery of the proxy  materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice and access rules also lower our cost of  printing and delivering the proxy materials and minimize the  environmental impact of printing paper copies.

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS AND NOMINATIONS  FOR THE 2018 ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING  OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deadline for submitting a shareholder proposal for  inclusion in our proxy materials for our 2018 Annual General  Meeting pursuant to SEC Rule 14a-8 is November 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such proposal must meet the requirements set forth in the  rules and regulations of the SEC, including Rule 14a-8, for such  proposals to be eligible for inclusion in our proxy statement and  form of proxy for our 2018 Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting must comply with the requirements set forth in our  Articles of Association.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other requirements in our  Articles of Association, to present business or nominate a  director at an Annual General Meeting, a shareholder must give written notice that complies with the Articles of Association to  our Corporate Secretary no earlier than 70 days and no later  than 45 days prior to the first anniversary of the date our proxy statement was released to shareholders in connection with  the prior years Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we must  receive notice of a shareholders intent to present business,  other than pursuant to SEC Rule 14a-8, or to nominate a  director, other than pursuant to the proxy access provisions of  our Articles of Association, no earlier than January 13, 2018  and no later than February 7, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: )  In addition to the representations, agreements and other information required to be furnished by the Nominator and Shareholder Nominee pursuant to this article 96(b), the Notice of Proxy Access Nomination shall set forth as  of the date of such notice: (1)  with respect to the Nominator or, in the case of a Nominator Group, with respect to each Group Member:   (A)  the name and address of each such person;   (B)   (aa) the class or series and number of shares of the Company that are, directly or indirectly, owned  beneficially and of record by each such person; (bb) any Derivative Instrument (as defined above)  directly or indirectly owned beneficially by each such person; (cc) any proxy, contract, arrangement,  understanding or relationship pursuant to which such person is a party and has a right to vote,  directly or indirectly, any class or series of shares of the Company; (dd) any Short Interest (as  defined above) held by each such person; (ee) any rights to dividends on the shares of the Company  directly or indirectly owned beneficially by each such person that are separated or separable from  the underlying shares of the Company; (ff) any proportionate interest in shares of the Company or  Derivative Instruments held, directly or indirectly, by a general or limited partnership in which such  person is a general partner or, directly or indirectly, beneficially owns an interest in a general partner;  and (gg) any performance-related fees (other than an asset-based fee) that such person is entitled to  based on any increase or decrease in the value of shares of the Company or Derivative Instruments, if any, including without limitation any such interests held by members of each such persons immediate family sharing the same household; and   (C)   any other information relating to each such person and the nomination that would be required to  be disclosed in a proxy statement, form of proxy or other filings required to be made in connection  with solicitations of proxies for the election of directors at an annual general meeting in a contested  election pursuant to Regulation 14A of the Exchange Act; and (2)  with respect to each Shareholder Nominee(s):   (A)  all of the information required to be furnished by the Nominator pursuant to article 96(b)(v)(1);   (B)  the age and residence address of such person; and   (C)  the principal occupation or employment of such person.

sentences.text: In the event that the Nominator, Nominator Group or any Group Member shall  have breached any of their agreements with the Company, or any information included in the Nomination  Statement or otherwise provided by the Nominator, Nominator Group or any Group Member to the Company  or its shareholders, ceases to be true and correct in all material respects (or omits a material fact necessary to  make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading), such  Nominator, Nominator Group or Group Member, as the case may be, shall promptly (and in any event within  5 days of discovering such breach or that such information has ceased to be true and correct in all material  respects (or omits a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under  which they were made, not misleading)) notify the Secretary of any such breach or inaccuracy or omission in  such previously provided information and shall provide the information that is required to correct any such  defect, if applicable.

sentences.text: ) In the event any Nominator or Nominator Group submits a nomination at an annual general meeting and such  Shareholder Nominee shall have been nominated for election pursuant to this article 96(b) at any of the previous  two annual general meetings and such Shareholder Nominee shall not have received at least 25% of the votes  cast in favor of such nominees election, or such Shareholder Nominee withdrew from or became ineligible or  unavailable for election to the Board, then such nomination shall be disregarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this article 96(b), the Company shall not be required  to include, pursuant to this article 96(b), a Shareholder Nominee in its proxy materials for any annual general  meeting, or, if the proxy statement already has been filed, to submit the nomination of a Shareholder Nominee  to a vote at the annual general meeting (notwithstanding that proxies in respect of such vote may have been  received by the Company): (1)  for any meeting for which the Secretary receives timely notice in proper form stating that any member  intends to nominate one or more persons for election to the Board pursuant to articles 50-51; (2)  who is not independent under the listing standards of each principal securities exchange upon which the  shares of the Company are listed, any applicable rules of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and  any publicly disclosed standards used by the Board in determining and disclosing the independence of the  Companys Directors, in each case as determined by the Board acting in good faith; (3)  who does not meet the audit committee independence requirements under the rules of any securities  exchange upon which the shares of the Company are listed or qualify as a non-employee Director for the  purposes of Rule 16b-3 under the Exchange Act (or any successor rule) or as an outside Director for the  purposes of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, in each case as determined by the Board  acting in good faith; (4)  whose election as a member of the Board would cause the Company to be in violation of these articles,  the Companys memorandum of association, the rules and listing standards of the principal securities  exchanges upon which the shares of the Company are listed, or any applicable law, rule or regulation or of  any publicly disclosed standards of the Company applicable to Directors, in each case as determined by the  Board acting in good faith; (5)  who is an officer or director of a competitor, as defined in Section 8 of the Clayton Antitrust Act of 1914; (6)  who is a named subject of a pending criminal proceeding (excluding traffic violations and other minor  offenses) or has been convicted in such a criminal proceeding within the past ten years; (7)  who is subject to any order of the type specified in Rule 506(d) of Regulation D promulgated under the  Securities Act of 1933, as amended, of the United States of America; (8)  if the Shareholder Nominee or Nominator, or, in the case of a Nominator Group, any Group Member (or  any owner on whose behalf the nomination is made) shall have provided information to the Company in  connection with such nomination that was untrue in any material respect or omitted to state a material fact  necessary in order to make any statement made, in light of the circumstances under which it was made, not  misleading, as determined by the Board acting in good faith; (9)  to the extent permitted under applicable law, the Nominator (or a qualified representative thereof) or, in  the case of a Nominator Group, the representative designated by the Nominator Group in accordance with  sub-paragraph (iii)(3) of this article 96(b) (or a qualified representative thereof), does not appear at the  applicable annual general meeting to present the Shareholder Nominee for election; or (10) the Nominator or, in the case of a Nominator Group, any Group Member, or the applicable Shareholder  Nominee, otherwise breaches or fails to comply in any material respect with its representations or  agreements made to the Company in connection with the nomination of such Shareholder Nominee.
